params.text: Q1. Complete the sentence with the correct form of the adverb.

tipsAndFeedback.notChosenFeedback:
It is the correct answer.
 
Explanation:
More sweetly uses the word more. It is a comparative adverb. It compares how two actions are done.

The sentence compares how Patricia sings with Samantha's singing. Two actions are compared. So, the comparative adverb more sweetly is used.

overallFeedback.feedback: Well done ! It is the correct answer.

params.text: Q3. Complete the sentence with the correct form of the adverb.

tipsAndFeedback.notChosenFeedback:
It is the correct answer.
 
Explanation:
Most efficiently uses the word most. It is a superlative adverb. It compares how more than two actions are done.

The sentence compares how Mike paints the walls with how other painters paint the walls. More than two actions are compared. So, the superlative adverb most efficiently is used.

params.text: Q4. Complete the sentence with the correct form of the adverb.

tipsAndFeedback.notChosenFeedback:
It is the correct answer.
 
Explanation:
Brightest is a superlative adverb. It compares how more than two actions are done.

The sentence compares how the bathroom's light shines and how the other lights on our house shines. More than two actions are compared. So,  the superlative adverb brightest is used.

overallFeedback.feedback: Awesome! It is the correct answer.

params.text: Q8. Complete the sentence with the correct form of the adverb.

tipsAndFeedback.notChosenFeedback:
It is the correct answer.
 
Explanation:
Brighter is a comparative adverb. It compares how two actions are done.

The sentence compares how the fire burnt when we added sticks and how it flared when we just used paper. Two actions are compared. So, the comparative adverb brighter is used.

overallFeedback.feedback: Super ! It is the correct answer.
